post_content_localized.en:
The winter months are a great time to visit the city, check out the best of what’s happening this January in Manhattan

Whether you are a fan of the outdoors or rather stay cozy inside, there is plenty of fun to explore in the city this month. Check out some of our top picks for what’s happening this January in Manhattan.

The New York Boat Show docks January 24-28 at the Javits Center as a boating and fishing lovers’ paradise. Whether you are there to learn from all of the expansive demos and breakout sessions, shop and compare makes and models of boats or gear up with the latest in accessories, You can explore the America's Boating Club Boating Simulator, Create-A-Boat Kids’ Toy Boat Building, the Miss Geico Offshore Racing Boat and preview the latest from boating and fishing manufacturers.

For those who love the southern taste of barbecue coupled with a cold beer or smooth bourbon, you can head to the Beer Bourbon & BBQ Festival on January 28th. Sample over 60 beers, 40 bourbons and mouth-watering BBQ with seminars, live music and even a bacon eating contest.

If you’d rather take it outdoors, Bryant Park’s Winter Village continues through January and is the location of Winter Carnival January 26th-27th and February 2nd-3rd. Enjoy winter sports and games, outdoor ice skating a brew house and a silent disco.

Continue the outdoor fun at Winter Jam in Central Park on January 27th. Visitors can learn to ski and snowboard, try out snowshoeing and sledding and some Arctic Golf. For those who would rather spectate, there is live ice sculpting and the Taste of NY Winter Market and warming hut for drinks and bites.

Whatever is on your schedule for this season in NYC, we hope you’ll include a stay with us at The Manhattan Club!
